text: It's isolated in a cul-de-sac of hills, with a dirt road

The place is decked out in classic bachelor.  Clothes eve Your mother would hate this place, but it's fine with -- SALLY HOGAN, an attractive WOMAN in her early 30's, who r She is nude, and has a look of blissful exhaustion on her She says nothing for a beat --
What time is it? Sally looks at the clock on the nightstand --
(Beat, closes her eyes)
Four-thirty...
(Beat)
I gotta get ready. We then see a MAN sit up and swing his legs over the bed. Sally hugs him from behind -- he reaches his arm around h
We still have time. Booth gets up, grabbing a random pair of underwear and wh
I have to go to the bank before it closes.
What for?
I gotta take some money out,  that's what for. Booth begins to put on his DEPUTY uniform --
There's an ATM on Speedwell Avenue.
Yeah but I need to take out four hundred dollars and the ATM will  only give me three.
Four hundred. Thinking of buying  me something nice? Booth puts on his BELT --
Well, not that I wouldn't sugar  bun but Earl's in a bind.  They're  going to take his car.
He's irresponsible. Booth puts on his olive green TIE --
Ah hell, he'd do the same for me.
Has he?
No.   (Beat)

But he would, probably. Booth sits on the edge of the bed and ties his black leat Booth gets up and brushes his hair --  Sally wraps the sheet around her and stands behind him -- Sally turns him around and straightens his tie --
I hope you get it back... (Beat)
We could have a lot of fun  with four hundred dollars...
They kiss -
Get a room in a nice hotel for a  few hours...
I might have to look into that... They continue to kiss --
The building is a small sub-station off a two-lane highwa
I tell you, some people are too damn  smart for their own good. Take that case in Richfield.
The mother son thing...
We see Sheriff DWAYNE HOGAN, a stout, ruddy-faced man in JESSE SEGUNDO, a Hispanic man in his late 30's, with a mi Also in the room are Booth and his partner EARL WHITNEY, to the conversation.

Soon as they got her on the table they knew it was murder, stroke or no.  I mean, what was this dumb son of a bitch thinking?  Trained  professionals wouldnГ­t find a needle  mark in her arm? Dwayne leans back and stretches, somewhat indifferent to
Just goes to show you.
I mean at least pick a more discreet place, the scalp, under the armpit, under the tongue, someplace where the  trained eye wonГ­t immediately look.
Jesse wipes his forehead with his HANDKERCHIEF -
Damn itГ­s hot in here...
He probably figured she was on her way out anyhow, no drugs in her system, no foul play.

Dwayne, IГ­m telling you a coroner has the skills and abilities to determine those things.  If you pump air into someoneГ­s vein, a series of traumas occur that are clearly visible upon dissection. Dwayne looks at Booth and Earl, who crack faint  smiles -
Very clumsy, very clumsy.  IГ­d have found it in a minute.
All right youГ­re the super sleuth, what do you want, a medal?
No. (smiles)
But what I would like is the forty  dollars you owe me, and IГ­m a busy man.
Dammit youГ­re persistent.  I donГ­t want to listen to this anymore.  No more bets with you. Dwayne takes out his CHECKBOOK - Jesse seems put off by  this -
Aw, now thatГ­s gonna take time to  clear!
(writing)
Take it or leave it. Booth and Earl seem amused by this encounter -
So what was your point, Jesse?

My point?  My point is that by  analyzing all the various ways by  which we kill each other, it seems  to me there is no perfect crime.   WeГ­ll get ya somehow, some way.   Except maybe if you use  potassium of something.
Huh? Jesse looks at the two me with a comically steely  expression -
Easy to purchase, hard to detect. Too much potassium can kill a man.
(laughs)
You must get a lot of babes with  lines like that. Everyone laughs but Jesse --
I think you need to get away from all those stiffs.  Find yourself a  little senorita of your own. An awkward beat, as Jesse stares at the floor.  Dwayne pi
Do you even have a girlfriend,  Jesse?
Sort of. Dwayne gets up, grabbing his lunch box --
Sort of!
Hey Dwayne why don't you introduce him to your funeral parlor cousin? Dwayne sucks on his teeth for a beat.  From his expressio Jesse's blood in the family line.
She's not his type.
Yeah.  That's all I need, to become  one of your in-laws. Dwayne then grabs his coat off the rack, and begins to he
IГ­m out of here. Jesse stands up -
All right, deputies, take care,  don't let your meat loaf.
Don't worry the real men are in  charge now.
Speaking of which that reminds me I have to bring something home or eat Sally's meatloaf again, and  I don't think I could stand that.
You're always griping.  Cut her  some slack! Dwayne heads out -- Booth watches him leave --
You've never had it.   (emphatically)
It's exactly like dog food. Earl laughs.  Booth gives a courtesy smile.
Ready to roll, partner?
Sure thing, and --  Booth slaps an envelope into Earl's hand --
Don't spend it all in one place.
I knew you'd come through. Jesse observes the transaction Booth and Earl start to le
What's that all about? Booth turns to Jesse as he heads out behind Earl --
Drug deal.  Pay it no mind. Jesse watches them leave --
A lone PATROL CAR drives down the highway --
CLOSE on the RADIO on the dash, which crackles to life --
Fourteen, you out there, copy? Booth, who is driving, Picks up the radio --
This is fourteen, what's up Trudy?
Got a call from Hank Scammel.  He's         worried about Otis.  Can't seem to  find him anywhere.
He probably died of old age. The two men laugh -- Booth keys the walkie --
All right Trudy we'll take a pass down Route 9, see if we can find him.
He'd appreciate that.
Don't be a stranger.
Thanks, Booth. Booth hangs up the radio --
How old is Otis anyhow, thirty?
The horniest dog in Nevada. Earl looks out the window --
(Beat)
Thanks for the loan, man.  I'll have it in a few days, I promise.
Well I hope so.  That pretty much cleaned me out.
I would have asked my sister, but its better to leave family out,  always leads to trouble.
I hear you.
The patrol car turns on to the desolate road and drives  off --

Yeah...I remember my brother-in-law  Gary, the wheel watcher.  He finally got on the show and won seven thousand  dollars!  Plus some leather furniture.   Do you think I saw any of that?  His  excuse was the government got it all.
Seven thousand...
He would have won more but he blew it at the end.  Didn't know what  Cash and Carry was.
Cash and what?
Cash and Carry, you know, FDR, World War two...
Never heard of it.
Oh, you would have done great.
I probably would have.  I guess  the clues damn near before everyone.
That's what everyone thinks.  But according to him, when it's the real thing, it's quite an intimidatin' environment in which to concentrate. Suddenly Booth sees something up ahead, his expression ch
What the hell is this? Soon he JAMS on his brakes --  POV         WILLIE lies in the road --
Booth and Earl get out and run over to the body, which ha
Who is it? Booth rolls the man over, checks for a pulse --  The gunman's lifeless eyes stare back at him --
He ain't from around here --  (Beat)
He's deader than Caesar. Earl looks around with his flashlight -- then sees someth
(ominously)
Get the car...  Earl starts walking down the road --  Booth watches him, then stands up startled by what he  sees --
The patrol car headlines illuminate the scene of the  crime --  Bodies everywhere, blood, broken glass --  Earl shines his mag light around the scene as Booth gets
(shocked)
What the hell...
They're out of towners... Arizona plates... Earl heads over to the back of the Mercedes.  The trunk i Booth goes down and checks the pulse of another dead  gunman --
Jesus, they're all dead... Earl opens the trunk carefully, and reacts with surprise  at WHAT HE SEES. Booth gets up, looks around, checks another one's pulse -
Well I'll be damned, I've never  seen anything like this... Gangbangers.  Must have been a  drug deal or something, whaddya  think? (beat)
Let's call this in.

I think you better come over here partner... Booth turns around and looks at Earl, then approaches him We see Booth approach the trunk -- as he looks inside his POV inside the trunk there is a STEAMER TRUNK.  Inside th arranged HUNDRED-DOLLAR BILLS, a little under three hundr
Holy...shit... Stunned, the men look at each other. Booth takes a packet
Ten thousand right here.
(digging through bag)
There must be over a million dollars in here.
Shit, more than that. Earl and Booth look at each other --
This is crazy... The two stare at the money in startled silence for a beat
I'm getting some flares... Booth heads off, as Earl pulls out a CIGARETTE out of a p He thinks for a moment, then drops the cigarette and stom
Wait a minute! Earl follows Booth --
What are we going to do?
What do you mean what are we going to do?
I mean --  Earl grabs Booth's arm --
What are we going to do? The two men look at each other, both knowing what the oth
Call it in I guess. (beat)
Why?
Why?  Are you kidding me? Booth looks at him, then grabs some flares out of the  trunk -
(beat)
No.  We can't.
Look around you partner!  You said yourself you never saw anything like it.
We don't know whose money it is!  They might have robbed  a bank, who knows?
Robbed a bank, c'mon!  Don't you think we would have heard if one, two --  (looking around)
shit I don't know how many were  at large!  Don't you think there would be a bulletin?  This is a  big ass drug deal!
We don't know that.
Come on Booth!  Look at these  scumbags around us.  Who's going  to know what happened!  Let's take  it and get out of here!
Well someone's gonna find them.
Hell, it won't be us! Booth looks at Earl --
It won't work.
Why?
I told Trudy we were coming down  this way, that's why!
We'll figure something out. Booth says nothing, as if he is actually considering it -
When's the next time you'll be face to face with a couple million dollars in cash, Booth?   Never! Booth looks at him --
We would never have to worry about  money -- ever again, Jesus!
Suppose someone knows about the  money?  They're bound to ask  questions.
Who's going to question us?   Dwayne?  Jesse?
It's going to go bigger than that.   Could you stare someone straight  in the face and lie about it?
I'll worry about that when it  happens and if it happens, and it's  not gonna happen!
What makes you so sure?
Because...I know. Earl looks at Booth, and pleads his case --
It's no accident we stumbled on this money.  It's an answer to a prayer!   (Beat)
Every night and every day I've  prayed that God would just --  help me out a little, give me a  little push.  Tonight my prayer  came true.
Oh so God's like Western Union and  he just dropped us a couple million  bucks?
That's right!
At the expense of six people.
(righteously)
They killed themselves.  Besides, they were breaking the law.  What they were doing was wrong! (Beat)
Whatsamatter Booth, don't you believe in miracles? Booth looks at him, then at the Mercedes --
Look, what do you say?  If we're going to do this we have to do it now.
All right hold on!  Lemme think... (beat)
Shit, did you touch the car?
Maybe.  Who cares?
I do.  It's little shit like that sends people to jail! We  have to cover all the bases  if we're going to pull this!
All right we will.
Earl thinks about it -- crickets chirp in the background Earl goes to the trunk of the patrol car and pulls out a
We'll cover all our damn bases... Booth looks at Earl, then back at the Mercedes, riddled w
We'll torch the bases, how's that?
Torch it?! Earl approaches --
We'll leave a few packets in the  trunk, and stash the rest somewhere  else.  Car went up in the gunfight.
I don't know.
Booth looks at Earl --
C'mon Booth.  Let's do this while we can.
Earl throws the last packets into a plastic bag held open
Two million eight hundred thousand --  sweet mother we're millionaires. (Beat)
I'll leave a couple.
I've got one condition.
What's that?
We're going to be patient. If we  start flashing money around, buying  fancy cars and fancy clothes, people  are going to ask questions.
Well, we won't do any of that shit! Earl leaves a couple of packets in the trunk, taking one of the remaining packets --
At least not for now.
Earl then takes a CAN of gasoline and begins to pour it o

Stick the money in our trunk --  Booth wraps the bag tightly around the money and places i he watches as Earl pours the gas under the car, then begi He then steps back -- the two men look at each other --
You got a match? Booth looks at Earl then gives him his matches --
Here goes...get back... Earl lights the C-note - CLOSE shot of the bill slowly approaching the fuel --  WHOOMP! The fuel IGNITES as Earl and Booth run back to th is ENGULFED IN FLAMES --

That tank's gonna blow --  BOOM!!!! The gas tank of the car EXPLODES, sending debris Booth and Earl cover themselves, illuminated by the brigh The two men watch --  The car is a flaming metal skeleton -- black smoke pours Earl then looks at Booth -
Let's call this sucker in.
Earl finishes on the mike.
...just south of mile marker                  87 on Route 9.
Roger that. Earl hangs up, walking over to Booth as he checks around
If this was a drug deal, where are the drugs? Earl lights up a MENTHOL CIGARETTE and contemplates the n

First thing I'm going to do is check out that new casino,  whatever the hell itГ­s called. Get a nice suite for myself,  some high-priced hookers and  some slow-roasted prime rib!  Booth turns and looks at him, angrily --
What are you talking about!   We have a deal!
When the time comes, that is. (Beat, overjoyed)
Hallelujah Booth!  We are rich! (shouting)
Earl slaps Booth on the back, Booth smiles --
Shhh!
What are you gonna do?
Well, I don't know.   (Beat)
I'm putting it out of my mind and you should too --  Suddenly the air is pierced by the SOUND OF PHLEGMY
Booth and Earl freeze --

What the hell was that? The two men look around -- the sound is coming from behin Earl and Booth runs over and stop dead in their tracks -- DENNING has rolled over on to his back, struggling to bre stares back at the two men -- he tries to speak but it is gurgle -
Can you hear me?  Denning struggles to talk but can't, he nods --
(panicked)
Oh shit! Earl gets down closer to Denning --
What's he trying to say!!
I don't know!  Son of a bitch!   Who the hell are you?
He saw everything! Grabbing him --
(to Denning)
How long you been lying there  playing possum with us, huh?   Answer me!
He'll tell them everything to save  his ass. That's how they all work  it!
Earl turns and looks to Booth -- Booth stares back at him
No...no!  No way! (clenches fist)
That money is in our hands! Earl grabs Denning who stares back at him, mute --
What did you hear!  How much did  you hear! Earl kicks the dirt in a rage --
Shit! Booth looks at Denning.  Earl snarls.
We're gonna have to get rid of him. Booth and Earl look at each other --  Then Booth looks around him anxiously, panic beginning to to understand what Earl means.
I'm not letting some gangbanger send me to jail.  We can't risk it.
What are you thinking? Earl looks at Denning, who looks pleadingly back at him -
I don't know...
You're thinking about killing him. (backing up)
I can't do that.  No way.  I've never killed a man.  Never even shot at one...
Well neither have I, but it's us or him.  If he talks, or writes a note, or whatever, he's gonna turn us in.  Besides,  he's a low life scumbag.   (turning to Denning)
His kind is hardly even human  anyway.
I...I can't do that.
Okay then.  I'll do it.
That's not what I mean.
Listen. Do you want to go to jail?   Taking evidence, tampering with a  crime scene.  You know what they'd do.   Earl looks at Booth.  Stares hard.  Booth looks down.
He would have done it to us,  right? Booth looks at him -- Earl waits a moment, then rips off
Exactly. (grabbing Booth's  shoulders)
This is our little secret, partner. Booth nods.  Earl crumples the jacket into a ball and squ hard on Denning's face --
No one's gonna miss your ass anyhow! Denning begins to struggle --
Dammit help me out here! Booth hesitates.

Come on, Booth! Finally, Booth restrains Denning while Earl presses down Booth turns his head away. Denning struggles violently --  The men struggle to suffocate Denning -- then Booth perks Soon the faint sound of SIRENS gets louder --
They're coming! HIGH SHOT - A small group of lights closes on the gas sta Earl hears the sirens and furiously crushes the coat down keeps fighting --
Dammit! The LIGHTS of the cars soon are visible to both of them - An AMBULANCE is followed by a PATROL CAR and a FIRE
In the nick of time Earl rips the coat away and lays it o Booth looks over his shoulder to see the oncoming vehicle
Earl pulls Denning onto the coat as the vehicles pull up The PARAMEDIC runs over to Earl --
What do we have?
Uh, we got a live one here, shot in the throat --
Clear me! Earl stands up and looks down at Denning --  Denning stares back up at him, the hate in his eyes going
Where's the ambu bag?! Dwayne Hogan gets out of the patrol car with Jesse --  He approaches Booth as another PARAMEDIC assists the firs
What the hell happened here?
Looks like some kind of drug deal or something, they're not from around here --  (looking back at Denning)
one of them's still alive. Earl stands above the paramedics --
Did you move him?
Uh, well he sort of moved himself. I was trying to stabilize him, clear his throat --  Fireman douse the car as Dwayne, Jesse and Booth approach Booth and Earl play it cool as the paramedics work --
He's lost a lot of oil -- can you hear me buddy?
Maybe he can tell us just what the hell happened here.
Look at me buddy -- focus! Denning's eyes continue to glaze over -- the paramedics g a resuscitating bag to give him oxygen --
Is he going to make it?
I don't know. I'm getting no radial pulse! The paramedics hoist Denning up and toward the ambulance Earl watches them, looks at Booth --  Booth stands with Dwayne and Jesse and looks back at Earl
I'd like to know what they were  doing in my town! (to Booth)
Did you get ID off any of them?
None of them had any --  The paramedics open the ambulance door and load Denning i paramedic gets on the radio --
OK notify the trauma center team  our ETA is twenty-five minutes --
(feeling Denning's  neck)
Oh shit.  I'm losing the carotid  pulse!
Stand by. The first paramedic assists the second --
Lift the legs!  Come on buddy,  fight! Earl watches --
Come on...buddy...
We're losing him! CLOSE on Earl --
(to himself)
Come on...come on... The paramedics begin to administer chest compressions -
Come on buddy fight!  Fight! The paramedics continue in vain --  Earl watches, clutching his fists at his side --

He's not going to make it --  In another part of the crime scene, Dwayne aims his flash his eyes seem to display a keen ability to find inconsist Soon he nears the spot where Denning relieved himself - h He locates some FOOTPRINTS, those of Denning, leading awa Dwayne notices the footprints and aims his flashlight int he turns the light off and heads back to the others -  Dwayne approaches Booth, Jesse, and the paramedic ---  Earl and Booth look at each other --
He's gone.  We lost him.
(takes a deep breath)
Damn.
I want to get some hounds down here.
Why?
Cause we got footprints leading  into that brush, I want to see where it leads... (Beat)
Jesus, seven dead.  I'll tell you  I've never seen carnage like this  in all my seventeen years of  sheriffing these parts. (Beat, spits)
I don't like it.  Not in my  jurisdiction. Dwayne heads toward camera as Earl and booth watch him --
This is gonna be in the papers, fellas. Booth and Earl look at each other grimly --
I'll finish up here.
Booth and Earl's patrol car drives down the highway, away
Booth and Earl say nothing for a stretch --
I tell you it was a miracle the way things turned out --
I don't want to hear about miracles and God and all that!  We tried to murder someone to cover our asses!
Well we didn't kill him, he died on his own. Booth flashes a totally unconvinced look at Earl and look
The patrol car pulls up past the camera. EXT. TRAILER HOME -- DAY. The patrol car comes to a stop in front of Booth's traile

head_text.subj: INT PATROL CAR ON DIRT ROAD

text: Booth looks at Earl --
Look.  Dwayne was right.  This is going to be a big story.  So big in fact that I don't want to even have this money around.
Fair enough, I'll take it to my place.
Forget it.  We're going to bury it, and we're not going to even think about it until everything dies down. (Beat)
And no one, I mean no one hears a word about it.         Understand? Earl looks at Booth for a beat --
Deal.

head_text.subj: EXT BURIAL SITE ABOVE BOOTH'S TRAILER

text: The men are on the hilltop above Booth's place.  The ligh full moon above, are the only sources of illumination. The men carry the bag of money to a hole they have finish They lower it into the hole and Booth prepares to tape up Earl stops him, takes a pinch of bills out of one of the
A little won't hurt us. Earl looks at Booth as he gives him $600 -- Booth accepts
We're even.                         POV of Booth and Earl looking down at the money.  They be darkening the frame until it is black --
CLOSE on a ringing phone near a clock radio reading
Sally answers the phone --
Hi.
Hi.
Heard you had quite a night.
Booth is on the phone, looking out the window at the hill money lies buried. BOOTH'S POV of the hilltop burial site.
Yeah.
It was all over the local news.   Dwayne was there, acting all  official.
(Beat)
I know.
(Beat)
What's wrong?
Nothing.
Nothing's wrong.
Oh.  You coming by tonight?
Are you sure you're OK?
Yeah I'm fine.
I'm just tired is all.  I'll see  you tonight OK baby?
OK.  I love you.
I love you too. Booth hangs up the phone and looks out the window again -
Booth walks into the station -- he looks ahead, surprised Earl is sitting with Dwayne and an attractive woman in he
Booth I'm glad you're here we've been waiting for you. Booth approaches --
This is Agent Ellen Martin. (Beat)
She's with the DEA. Booth looks at Earl for a split second then shakes Martin
How are ya?
Hello.
I guess we can get started.
I wanted to ask you some questions about last night.
Sure. (calmly)
We've all got questions about what happened. Earl pulls out his menthol cigarettes, and lights one up
Would you mind not smoking? Earl looks at Dwayne, and Booth, then back at Martin -
No problem. Earl drops the cigarette on the ground --
Thank you. (Beat)
Now, do you remember seeing any  vehicles traveling near the site,  on your way to or from?
No.  Why?
Because someone may have gotten  away.
What makes you say that?
We had hounds down at the scene, the footprint trail was a bust. And there were no other tire tracks in the vicinity. Martin looks at the men.
I understand that.  But from  what we know, there was a  large sum of money involved in  the transaction, about three  million dollars. (beat)
It seems to have disappeared. Booth whistles at the amount --
Could it have been in the  Mercedes?
Maybe.  That's where it was  during Denning's last report. Earl shifts in his chair.
Denning's their man on the  inside. Martin pulls a photo out of a file in front of her.  Hand
He was the man you tried to save  last night. Agent Paul Denning.   We were working together. (sighs, long beat)

He was deep undercover with these dealers for a while.  They ran a  big operation in Arizona, Nevada,  California.   Earl fights to play it cool as Dwayne listens to Martin, the worst shape of all, sickened by the revelation.
Normally we would have tracked him with a wiretap, but it was standard for him to occasionally drop out when working with these guys. The last we heard from him was two days ago.
You mean that guy was an agent?
Yes.  Wife and a kid.   (Beat)
Don't blame yourself, Deputy.  You  did all you could.  You have our deepest gratitude...and my personal thanks. A pregnant pause envelopes the room --
In fact, I've asked Sheriff Hogan for permission to enter a letter of commendation in each  of your files. (beat)
Agent Denning was a good man. I served with him for nearly five years... Booth looks at Earl, hard.  Earl decides to break the sil
So I guess we won't find out  what happened. Martin gets up --
Well, we have one lead and that's  what I'm looking into next.
What's that?
Denning was wearing a bug.  Booth and Earl look at each other -- Dwayne gets up.
He kept a recording of all such  transactions in order to keep  track of who's who, what was said,  what's happening.  I contacted your  local coroner, and he found it taped  to his back.
That's news to me.  So it's over at Jesse's office?
Yeah.  I told him I'd be there  before five.
Excellent. I'll go down with you. Dwayne looks at Booth and Earl --
You boys coming? Booth and Earl watch the two get ready to leave --
We'll follow in our car.
Dwayne's patrol car zooms down the road -- soon Booth and
Booth and Earl drive, completely panicked.
We're dead.  We're dead,  We are dead... (beat)
What are we going to do?!
I don't know...
This isn't a joke. What are we going to do!
I don't know you want me to put  on my cape and fly there?! (Beat)
We're going to play it cool... besides there might be nothing  on that tape anyway...
That guy was a Federal agent. An officer of the law, just like  us.
Well, we didn't know that at the time.
We assaulted a Federal agent.  We killed him.
No we didn't.  He died on his own.
Oh, right, with a little help from his pals Booth and Earl.  I'm sure that's gonna fly real far when they hear that tape... A horrible pause.  Then Booth finally says it.
We gotta turn ourselves in, before  they hear the tape.
Are you nuts?  They'll fry us for  sure.  There's no way we're doin'  that, you understand?  No way.
It's the right thing to do.
It's the stupid thing to do,  that's what it is. Booth considers for a moment.  Relents.
I should have known something like this was going to happen!
Man take it easy!  You're sweating like crazy!   Booth takes a deep breath, trying to calm himself down -
Whatever happens, don't lose your  cool.
The car drives off --

CLOSE on a pair of hands holding a PLASTIC EVIDENCE BAG - RECORDER and a small MICROPHONE attached to a wire --  Jesse hands the bag to Ellen Martin -- Dwayne scrutinizes Booth gets a glass of water and drinks it down --  Earl watches as Martin opens the bag --

All right gentlemen -- maybe this will shed some light on what  took place. Martin rewinds the tape and we hear noise on the tape.  Dwayne is excited by the event, hoping to get some  answers -- he looks at Booth and Earl.
It's kind of like those black boxes on the planes, you know, like the last seconds?  I figure most of what they hear is "AAAAAAAAAAAGH!" (laughs)
What do you think? Not amused, Booth and Earl force smiles --
I don't know.

This just might be our ticket! Martin and Jesse look at Dwayne -- just then the tape  stops --  CLOSE on Booth, who looks as if he might start trembling Earl sniffs, tries to play it cool but there is real fear Martin looks at the two men for a beat, then --  CLOSE on Martin's thumb as she presses down the small PLA Dwayne perks up --  Jesse perks up --  Booth swallows hard --  Earl sniffs again -- the tape starts --  It is STATIC.  Martin lets it play for a while -- Dwayne
What the hell? Martin fast forwards -- more static --
That's odd. Booth and Earl look at each other --  Martin fast forwards again -- static.
Maybe the microphone was damaged.
Looks OK to me... Martin fast forwards again -- static.  She lets it play.
Well nothing audible to us.  Maybe the lab can pick something up.
Damn!
I'm sorry to have dragged you all  the way down here for that.  I  thought maybe it would help. Booth lets out an inaudible deep breath -- Earl immediate
What other leads did you come up with?
Not too many.  But we're still  collecting evidence from the scene.
Well we'd like to help you in any  way we can.  We're all in this  together, as law enforcement  officers.
We appreciate that. The tape continues to play static --
Booth and Earl exit the coroner's office, into the busy h -- Earl gestures into the room --
We'll be seeing you. Booth and Earl walk down the hallway, saying nothing unti
The two men exit -- Booth leans against the wall and Earl his knees --  Soon Earl laughs weakly.  Booth does the same.  Soon they relief --  The two men look at each other --
So what are you doing tonight  partner? The two men laugh even harder --
I'm going out partner.  How 'bout  you?
Me too.
PAN a crowded bar --  MONTAGE of Earl living it up.  Music blares as he treats drinks, dances, lives it  up, all the time paying cash --
Long shot of the front of the house, somewhere in the cit is parked out front.
Dwayne is dressed in his bowling shirt, standing outside and his voice is soft and slightly slurred -- he pauses f
Come on...I'm sorry.  Really I am. (beat)
Won't you open the door?
The door opens, AND THERE IS SALLY.  She is hesitant, and
I'd never do anything to hurt you.  You know that, right? Sally nods, her head slightly bowed.
You just mind that sarcasm. and I'll mind my manners.  Deal? She nods again.  Satisfied, Dwayne reaches down, picks up
Now I'll be back by 10, for the kiss-and-make-up part.  You don't have to wait up.  I'll wake ya.
And with that, he's out the door.
Dwayne gets in his car, driving past a few others parked the headlights on one of the cars turn on, and it drives
Booth opens the door without knocking.  He carries a pack
Sally? There's no answer.
Sally?  I was beginning to think he wasn't gonna leave.
(o.s., cheery)
I'm in here.
Booth enters, as Sally turns from the makeup mirror to gr and her smile hides it well. Booth holds out the package.
You got me something?  What's the occasion?
You deserve it is the occasion. Sally opens the box -- her eyes widen as she takes out se and expensive, LINGERIE --
I tell you I got hard in the  store thinking about you in these! Sally and Booth burst out laughing -- they kiss.   Booth looks hard into her eyes, and suddenly his expressi
What happened to your cheek?
Oh I...nothing...
Nothing happened?
Dwayne got a little tipsy is all. He doesn't handle pressure well. (Beat)
It's over. Booth's eyes narrow.
Like hell it's over.  You told me he wasn't doing this anymore.
He's not, he's...
That son of a bitch.
Booth.  Don't.  It's nothing. It's not worth it.  Remember what happened the last time? Booth looks away.
Let's not get into this again. I know him.  If you said something, he'd take it out on me.
And I'd take it out on him.
And I'd end up a widow in two ways.   (beat)
Let's forget it.  I'll just be a little more careful  next time.
There isn't gonna be a next time. We're gonna get out of here.
And go where?  He'd find me. I  know you don't think so, but he  would. Booth thinks for a beat.
What if we could go really, really far? Sally tries to put an end to it, with a change of tactic.
We don't have to.  We've got everything we need right here. Sally wraps her arms around Booth, kissing him deeply.  T in her hand.
Baby...this must have been  expensive.  He doesn't want to give in, but Sally's made up her mind.
You're worth every last penny.
Well, I can't let you down now,  can I? Sally seductively touches his chest, and walks off with t

Booth sits on the edge of the bed, watching --  Sally comes out, dressed up in the sexy outfit: bra, pant Booth watches her as she approaches him --  She seductively straddles him, kisses him full on the lip frame -- Booth reacts accordingly at the right moment --
Booth is now on top, as the two go at it like animals, Sa They both climax, and Booth kisses Sally -- Sally looks a
Dwayne's gonna love me in this. Booth looks at her --
It's a joke, silly. The two kiss some more -- soon the sound of VOICES rises
How long you been lying there  playing possum with us, huh?   Answer me!
He'll tell them everything to save  his ass. That's how they all work  it!
It slowly gets louder --
No...no!  No way! That money is in  our  hands!  What did you hear!   How much did you hear!
PAN a dimly lit room, as the sounds of the voices get cle
Shit! (Beat)
We're gonna have to get rid of him. (coldly)
I'm not letting some gangbanger ruin my life.  We can't risk it.
What are you thinking?
I don't know... As the camera continues to pan we see the voices are comi
You're thinking about killing him. I can't do that.  No way.  I've never killed a man.  Never even shot at one.
Well neither have I, but it's us or him.  If he talks, or writes a  note        or whatever, he's gonna turn us  in.  Besides, he's just a low life  scumbag.  His kind is hardly even  human anyway.
I can't do that.
Okay then.  I'll do it. Soon a hand approaches the recorder --
That's not what I mean.
Listen.  Do you want to go to jail? Taking evidence, tampering with a  crime scene.  You know what they'd  do.
He would have done it to us, right?
Exactly.  This is our little secret, partner. The hand shuts off the tape and we see the listener is  J look in his glassy eyes as he takes a swig of BOURBON --
The burned-out Mercedes sits in the center of the room -- Ellen Martin looks at it with forensic expert JOE WALLACE
You want to hear the good news first, or the bad news?
Give me the bad news.
We retrieved a few things from the trunk, including a steamer trunk,  or the remnants of a trunk, the  brass clips and so forth.
Anything in it?
Money. Martin looks at Wallace --
But nowhere near three million dollars worth.  I would say maybe twenty thousand.
(bluntly)
There was more than that.
Not in the trunk.
That doesn't tell us much. Did you run a check on the gas like I told you?
Yeah, we did.  It was unleaded, high octane.
So...what's the good news?
The car's a diesel.   Again, Martin looks at Wallace -
That fire was set.  Deliberately. And probably not by anyone found at the scene.
So someone did get away.

I don't know how else you'd explain it.  The coroner's estimated time of death for everyone there was long before this fire started, unless of course Denning started it, and that doesn't make much sense.
No, it doesn't.  Neither does his  blank tape.  Any news on that?
We're doing a check on the  manufacturers'        serial number, see  if there were other defective tapes  in the bunch. (Beat)
What's your take on these local boys?  Are they providing any answers? Martin seems deep in thought -- a skeptical look crosses
No.  I don't think they see much of this kind of thing. (Beat)
But they're going to.
Jesse looks out the window of the station --
I suppose no man can judge another's actions unless he has been in the same situation himself, presented  with the same temptations. (beat)

And money sure is tempting.  Hell, some people will pretty much do  anything for money...lie, cheat,  steal, swindle... Jesse turns and looks --   Booth and Earl listen to him, grim expressions on their f
...kill. (beat)
I don't suppose it would be too  hard to kill a man, especially if  he's half dead, especially if he's  of the criminal persuasion. (beat)
How did you know he was a federal  officer with a wife, and a baby on  the way? Earl and Booth say nothing.  Jesse laughs --
You gentlemen look like you're about to toss your collective cookies.
Why don't you get to the point.
My point, well... Jesse gets up --
Hey we're all friends, right?   Friends don't squeal on friends,  that's not what Jesse Segundo is  all about.
Then what the hell are you all  about? Jesse looks hard at Earl --
Listen Earl.  I covered for you.   For both of you.  I put my ass on  the line to save yours, so don't pull a hostile tone with me!
(resigned)
What's your offer, Jesse?
My offer?  Well I'd say it's a fair one, like I said we're friends.  All I want is my share, which I guess is... Booth and Earl watch Jesse as he fast-forwards through th
I think it's around here... Jesse then plays --
"Two million eight hundred thousand sweet mother we're millionaires." Jesse clicks the tape off --
I'll settle for a third of that.
And if we refuse?  Your tampering  with evidence isn't exactly a  misdemeanor, did you ever consider  that?
True, but neither is attempted murder. In fact I'd say that's considerably worse, wouldn't you, Earl? Earl says nothing --
Besides, I'm not stupid, Earl. The  tape was a basic Maxell D-80.  You  can buy 'em at any store.  There's  no way they can pin anything on me.
All right, Jesse, we'll play it your way, under one condition.
I'm all ears.
We're going to wait.  All of us,  until everything dies down.
Well, I don't know...
That's the deal.  If you don't  like it, forget it, no one wins. Jesse looks at Booth --
Ok...I'll wait.  For now. But I'm going to need a little advance, to oil the wheels, so  to speak.
How much?
(pondering)
I understand your logic, Booth,  but I don't think...two thousand's  going to raise any eyebrows, do  you?
Two thousand...
(sternly)
By Friday.
The lights are on in the house --

Holding a remote, Sally flips through the channels, stopp and Famous" type show --  POV of the television -- high-life on the Riviera --  Dwayne enters, popping open a can of BEER -- it overflows overflow --
Son of a bitch!  Did you drop these? Sally looks at him and then back at the screen --

Careful not to get any on the  floor. Dwayne puts the beer on a table next to his chair --  Dwayne gingerly lowers himself into his chair, appearing Dwayne notices what's on TV and seems mildly disappointed
What's this?
I don't know... Sally watches the luxurious scenes on the TV --  DWAYNE
Is this all that's on? She gets up and hands him the remote --
Here, watch what you want.  I'm  going to take a shower. Sally heads out of the room and Dwayne watches her leave takes another sip of his beer, shifts uncomfortably in hi
Having undressed, Sally wraps a towel around her and walk the sound of the shower begins --
CLOSE on Dwayne's hand flattening his empty beer can --  Dwayne belches loudly -- he then shifts in his chair agai
Damn it. Dwayne gets up and walks offscreen into the kitchen, hold opening and closing --
Aw, where the hell is that thing...
Dwayne closes his closet door -- irritated, he goes to th
Hey where's the hot pad?
What?
Where's the hot back -- the  therapeutic pad thing?
I can't hear a word you're saying!

Forget it. Dwayne checks in a dresser, then opens a closet, begins t Dwayne pulls out a CORD which is attached to a HOT PAD -- fall off the shelf onto the ground, including a SHOE BOX Dwayne looks at the ground --  A LACE STRAP pokes out of the box - Dwayne crouches down, slowly takes the lid off -- we hear Sally getting out of the  shower --  Dwayne lifts up the EXPENSIVE LINGERIE and looks at it wi

What the hell?... He lifts up the individual garments, turning them around The bathroom door opens and Sally comes out in a towel an Dwayne, playing it cool - Dwayne looks back at her --  Sally approaches him --
What are you digging around in my closet for?
I was looking for the hot pad! Sally goes to grab the lingerie out of Dwayne's hand -- h
You mind telling me where the hell this came from?  (Beat)
Is there something I don't know  about?  Sally looks Dwayne in the eye and fights to be casual, ac
What do you mean? Dwayne looks hard at her --
I mean are you spending my money on other things I don't know about?  Got any furs in there? Mildly relieved, Sally grabs the lingerie out of Dwayne's
Don't be ridiculous!  It wasn't so expensive! Sally puts the box back --
It was going to be a surprise!
A surprise huh?  Well I don't like  any surprises, especially if  I'm forking over the loot for  them! Sally closes the door and looks at him for a beat before from him --
You're a real smooth talker, you know that? Sally goes to the mirror and combs her hair out --
What are you saying?
I'm saying you're about as romantic  as a bag of sand.
(menacing)
Watch that.  Watch that tone. Dwayne looks at her with a surly but suspicious expressio exchange and leaves with his hot pad.  When he's gone, Sally looks at herself in the mirror with
Booth and Earl's PATROL CAR is parked next to the trailer

text: Standing in front of where the money is buried, Booth cro
I could kill that no good son of a bitch!
All right enough!  I'm tired of  thinking about all this!
Well I'm not! (Beat)
Thinks he's got us by the balls.
Well doesn't he?  Besides if the DEA heard that tape we'd be behind bars right now.  Just call it the cost of doing business. (Beat)
This whole thing is screwed up. (Beat)
I'm thinking.  Maybe we should tell 'em the truth... Earl gives Booth a "get real" look. Incredulous.
...Or get rid of the money.  I don't know.
I've got a better idea.  All we  have to do is straighten out Jesse.
And how do you figure we do that?
All we have to do is get our hands on the original tape.  We'll set  him up somehow.
He's probably made copies.  He's not  going to give them up to us.
Forget the copies!  He could have  made up the copies -- the only  thing that incriminates us is the  original. Booth rifles through the bag --
He's going to be trouble.
He's a partner now, Earl, like it  or not. Earl looks around --  Booth inspects the money, then looks up at Earl -
Have you been back here? Earl looks at him for a beat, guiltily -
Yeah I just took a little out.   I'm keeping track of it, you can trust me. Booth gets up.
We had a deal!  What was I,  talking to the wall?

For Christ's sake, Booth, I just  needed to take care of a few debts is all!  You  got my word on it --I'm not going near it  again until everything cools down. Booth looks at Earl for a beat, then proceeds to take out before hastily sealing up the  bag --
You said that last time!
Well I mean it this time. (Beat)
Come on.  Let's get this over  with! The men begin to fill the hole with dirt --
Booth and Sally walk slowly, and close together, down a r
I told him I bought the lingerie,  as a surprise.  I don't think he suspects anything, but now you know, if he mentions it.
How the hell did he find it?
He started digging through my  closet, something he never does.
Great...
It's OK, Booth, it's no big deal.
Let's hope so.
If he asks me again, I'm gonna tell him I returned it all.
Dammit, I'm so sick of this.
(sighs)
I know.
Every night I think about you sleeping with him, him slobbering all over you.
He doesn't slobber, he just snores. And I told you we haven't...done  anything in over a year.
It doesn't matter...he's next to  you. (Beat)
You know, I always say to myself,  you should have left him years ago. Why didn't you?
I used to think he was something, once... (Beat)
I was eighteen, I didn't know any better, and he had something  steady to offer. Booth shakes his head to himself --
You get into a routine, after a few years, when the thrill was gone, I just said to myself this is my destination, I guess. Sally looks at Booth --
And then I met you. Booth looks back at her --
Let's just get out of here, get  out of this -- place.  We'll drop  out, get a house have some kids,  get a satellite dish...
I hate it when you talk like this. (beat)
Go on.
We'd... I don't know...go to  California, New York, maybe a  house on a Swiss mountainside...
It'd have to be Switzerland to  make sure Dwayne never finds us.
Whatever it takes... Sally stops walking --
What's got into you? Booth notices Sally has stopped walking -- he stops and l arrange his thoughts --
I'm bored, you know?  I'm  frustrated.  I want it to work  for us. Sally approaches him, and they embrace --
So do I.
(Beat)
I love you Sally.
I love you. They kiss -- Sally puts her head on his shoulder --
What are we going to do?
We're going to figure it out.  It won't be long. (Beat)
Trust me. They kiss again, and Booth puts his arm around her --
A satellite dish?
Well I was just throwing out  ideas... They walk down the lane, saying nothing --
MONTAGE of all the casinos, the crowds, the glitter -

At the entrance of one casino, people are seen pulling up luggage, leaving and arriving -  Slowly a figure emerges from the crowd, alone, walking de walks into the harsh sunlight, oblivious to the people ar exhausted -- He squints from the glare, puts on his sunglasses and loo He stands there for a beat, then lets out a prolonged, de His PAGER goes off - Jesse reads the number -
Jesse wipes down his forehead with one hand and digs in h he comes up with a measly handful of change and stuffs it he picks up the phone and dials the operator -
I wanna make a collect call...
Dwayne approaches a phone -
Line six, chief... Dwayne presses the appropriate extension and picks up the
Jesse?
Yeah whaddya want?.
What the hell are you calling collect for?
I'm at a payphone in Vegas.  What's up?
Vegas!  Can you hightail it back  here by three o'clock?
Why?
Well, we got the DEA coming down here again, I don't know, sounds to me like they got some more questions they want to ask us.
(Beat)
About what?
Well they really didn't go into any details on the phone, but they did ask for you, and I  figure we should try to help them out as best we can.
(Beat, looks around)
Uh, sure.  I hear you.
So be here at three.
I'll do my best...that doesn't give me much time.
I  have complete faith in you.   But don't you go speeding.
Yeah...see you at three. Jesse hangs up the phone with a concerned expression on h
A car pulls up and Earl gets out in front of the small La mail out of the box and approaches the modest house -- he in --
Earl walks in with the mail -- Earl's MOTHER is washing d
Hi ma.
Hi. She turns off the water and dries her hands --
I didn't know you were coming.
I was in the neighborhood.
Is that the mail?
Yeah. Earl's mother inspects the mail -- she seems disappointed Earl's mother drops the mail on the counter --
How's work?
Well, same ol' same ol'. Earl pours himself a glass of MILK from out of the refrig
People have been asking me about that story in the paper.  I told them you were the first person on the scene.  They were asking me for all the details.
It was pretty gory ma, let me tell you.  But you have to turn all that off, and do your job, just  like pop used to say.
Did they ever find out who they were?
Nope. If you're a criminal you don't carry ID, and if you do you're a damn fool.
I tell you this world just keeps getting more and more violent.
At least around here it does.
(goes to pantry) Are you hungry?
Yeah sure I'll grab something  before I go... (Beat)
Hey -- I've got a surprise.
You do? Earl takes a sip of his milk, then smiles at his mother -
You want to see it?
Earl carries a large, heavy BOX through the front door an
What is it? Earl stands up, stretches his lower back -
There was this raffle going on  at the station, some charity or church was running it, I forget, so I figure what the hell put in my five bucks...
And what happened?
Well basically I forgot about it, you know, you never win these things, but this time, well...  Earl rips the paper off the box to reveal a large WINDOW
I won! Earl's mother heads over to him, looking at the box --
Well what do you know!  An air conditioner.
And not just any air conditioner. This baby sells for over six hundred dollars retail.
That's great Earl!
Yep, fifteen thousand BTU's,  enough to cool off this whole  place.
This whole place?
Yeah.  Figured you could have it. Earl's mother stares at him for a beat --
Don't you want it?
Ah, hell I'll get one soon enough.  Besides, I want you  to have it.
(laughs)
Well I don't know --
You've done without it long enough,  ma.
Earl picks up his milk glass -
Just like the commercial says, you deserve a break today... He takes a swig of milk --  Earl's mother looks at the air conditioner, pleasantly su
We can put it in the living room window... (Beat)
This is great Earl.  Earl's mother hugs him --
Thank you honey.  are you sure you don't want it?
(casually)
Absolutely positively.
It will certainly be an improvement... (Beat)
what was the charity again? Earl sets the glass on a table --
(Beat)
I don't remember.  But I'm glad I  gave it a shot.
Dwayne looks at his watch -- 3:25 --  Martin, Booth, Earl, and Dwayne sit in the station --  Suddenly Jesse walks through the door, with an ashen expr
Nice of you to join us.  I did say         three o'clock, didn't I?
Well I'm here now. Booth and Earl react to Jesse's expression as he sits  down --
What's up?
I wanted to meet with you all to go over some new information about the murders.
Did you find a suspect? Martin looks at Jesse --
Uh, no...
Don't you think I would have told you that!
Well what is it?
We discovered something interesting  about the tape Denning was wearing. (Beat)
Based on the serial number, we've  determined that the tape was  purchased locally. Jesse swallows.  Hard.
Yeah?  So?
It's odd.  I don't know how Denning had the time, or the ability to buy something local, based on his situation.
Well I suppose you would know more about his situation than us. Martin stares at Earl --
Maybe.  Maybe not.
What are you getting at?
Well, unfortunately Denning's not here to tell us, but I would say someone got their hands on that tape and switched it.
Why would someone do that?
Because they don't want anyone to hear what's on it, obviously.   Martin looks directly at Jesse -- Dwayne turns and does t Jesse looks at them --
Well, like you said, he's not here to tell us.
That's true...that's true. Just then Martin's beeper goes off -- she reads it --
Excuse me, I have to make a phone call. Martin goes over to a phone --  Dwayne looks at Jesse --
Something wrong, Jesse?
No.  Something wrong with you Dwayne?
You walked in here looking like  you just ate a shit sandwich.
Well, I just got a lot of things  on my mind is all. Dwayne shrugs and looks at Booth and Earl --
What do you think about all this?
Hell, I don't know.  If I had  some input I'd offer it up.
We gotta roll anyhow.  How long is  this going to take? Martin hangs up --
Whatsamatter with you?  Aren't you  concerned about all of this?
I can't get enough of it. Martin approaches the men as Booth and Earl get up -
Anything else we can do for you?
Well, I wanted to ask you a few more questions, but I have to go.         I'm sorry. Martin looks at Jesse --
Thanks for coming down.
Any time.
We're out of here.
Right behind you. Booth, Earl, and Jesse all head out --  Martin watches them leave -- Dwayne addresses her --
We just got started, where you headed off to? Martin continues to watch the men leave, then turns her a
Oh that was Agent Wallace.  We're going to check into something.
Maybe I should come along. Martin appears reluctant for a moment --
Don't you have to be here?
Hell no. besides I'm just a radio  call away if something happens. I feel I should keep abreast of what happens, seeing it's my jurisdiction and all.
Mm-hmm...
Look, agent Martin...
Ellen...
Ellen... (Beat)
I know you might think this is a small town, and we do things a  certain way, but I don't want you to confuse that with...a lack of resolve. Dwayne's expression becomes more determined -
I don't like people getting away from me, and I'm prepared to  scour the earth for whoever did it. I want you to know that. Martin and Dwayne look at each other for a beat - Martin
(Beat)
Ok, sure.  Let's go.
Booth and Earl exit and Jesse approaches them from behind
Meet me at the Tumbleweed Diner.
What?
Just do it!  Meet me there, now. Booth and Earl watch Jesse as he makes a beeline for his  car --
PAN the local diner --  Jesse drags on a cigarette and faces Booth and Earl as th
There's going to have to be a change in our arrangement.
What are you proposing?
I want my share. All of it.
Forget it. Jesse takes another drag and stares hard at Earl -
I'm not asking.
Well you're not getting, either.
Listen - Jesse looks around the diner --
I don't like getting grilled by that DEA bitch, I don't like taking that kind of heat!
None of us like it!
Well I don't know what's going  to happen next -- she's pressing  this, another interrogation,  another problem.
Just take it in stride.
(loud)
I'm not gonna take --          (beat, quieter)
I'm not gonna take it in stride. (Beat)
I had a good run turn to shit on me like that -  (snaps finger hard)
cleaned me out.
What do you mean?  You gambled it?
I was on a roll!  IГ­m a little overextended now.
Oh Jesus Christ...
So I want the money and I want it now.
Well you can't have it. Jesse stares at Earl with a mixture of desperation and ir

Look...I can turn that tape over to Martin and come out smelling  like a rose, you understand that  Earl?  So I'm going to make you a  final proposition.  I want two  million dollars tonight, or the  tape goes into her hands tomorrow morning. Booth and Earl stare at Jesse for a beat --
You're out of your mind.
Yeah, I mean you're coming unglued,  Jesse.
You want to see how more unglued I can get?  Try me.
You're never getting that much.
I think I am.         Jesse gets up --
I'll give you until nine o'clock tonight to bring it to my house. Jesse look at the table --
Hope you don't mind picking up  the tab. Booth and Earl watch Jesse storm off --
A patrol car zooms down the road --
Booth drives and Earl looks out the window --
You think he's bluffing?
No.
Neither do I. Earl sighs loudly and looks out the window --
Look, Earl.  We gotta go straight.   This is all messed up...
If you're any friend at all, you'll  stop talking like that!
Maybe we can reason with Jesse, give  him a third in exchange for the tape.
I don't think he's going to be doing any bargaining with us, the stupid son-of-a-bitch!  Besides, I'm not giving him a third of anything, not after everything we had to do.
Well what are we supposed to do?
I don't know...we have to shut  him up somehow. Booth looks at Earl --
Jesse's a reckless guy, Booth.   Got a lot of monkeys on his back. Who knows, maybe it all catches  up with him somehow. Booth realizes what Earl is saying.
You're crazy.
How badly do you want that money?!  How bad do you want to stay out of jail?
Not bad enough to kill him.
Who said anything about killing? (beat)
Just keep driving straight...
The car drives down the street --
Establish the bank, with a patrol car in front --
Martin, Wallace, and Dwayne are in a room with the bank m On a table are three HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS -

Mr. Curtis called us this afternoon. The bills arrived at this branch from a cash drop.  Came through a store called After Midnight.  There's only four employees, none of them can tell us who passed them.
Is this marked money, or what? Dwayne looks at Martin and Wallace --
Some of it.  Denning only handled a small portion of the total, but it looks like this was one of his  bills.
So there was money there!  Who the hell's money is it?!
We don't know.  Whoever got this payload together has one hell of a laundering system.
Have you known this all along?
Well you can understand why we didn't say anything.  If word got out that we had a track on the money it would only work  against us.
Well yes I understand that, we don't want them high-tailing it out of here. Martin then looks at Dwayne --
Sheriff Hogan --
Dwayne.
(smiles)
Dwayne... (Beat)
It is imperative that we keep  this confidential.        Now we know  someone's out there.  Very close.  It may even be the son of a bitch  that killed my partner.
Fine.  The information doesn't leave  this room. Martin looks at the bank manager -
I'm not gonna say anything!
Yeah -- this is confidential.
OK...this is good.  Our first solid lead.
Did you say After Midnight?
Yeah.
What the hell is that, some kind of porno store or something?
Not exactly.  It's some lingerie  store on the strip.
Lingerie...
Yeah, racy stuff, you know the  kind, right?
Sure...
The lights are on inside --
Dwayne and Sally face each other, eating at a table --  Nothing is said for a considerable length, Dwayne focused occasionally looking up at Dwayne --  Soon Sally puts her fork down --
All right what's the matter? Dwayne looks up, then back at his plate --
Nothing.  Nothing's the matter.
Aren't you going to tell how your day went?
Not much to tell.  Nothing really happened.
That hasn't stopped you before. Dwayne looks up at her --
Funny... Dwayne resumes eating --
Suppose I'm not exciting enough for you.
I didn't say that.  You did.
Well you might as well say it. Mister Small Time...
Just trying to be civil Dwayne. Dwayne continues eating --
Don't you want to hear about my day?
Yeah let's hear about your day.
Well I got the tires rotated, I went shopping, and I made dinner. Dwayne doesn't respond --
